item.title: Consolidated Land, Energy, and Aquatic Resources Act of 2010

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 510.

item.title: Offshore Oil and Gas Worker Whistleblower Protection Act of 2010

latestAction.text: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1574, H.R. 5851 is laid on the table.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 194 (Roll no. 500). (text: CR H6462-6463)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 194 (Roll no. 500).(text: CR H6462-6463)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H6482)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1574, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the resolution and by voice vote, announced that the ayes prevailed. Mr. Sessions demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of H.Res. 1574 until later in the legislative day.
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H6468)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1574.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H6462-6468)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 229.

General debate for H.R. 3534 shall be one hour and forty minutes. After general debate, the bill shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule. And, it shall be in order to consider as an original bill the amendment in the nature of a substitute printed in Part A of the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying the resolution. Notwithstanding clause 11 of rule XVIII, no amendment to that amendment in the nature of a substitute shall be in order except those printed in Part B of the report of the Committee on Rules. The rule also makes in order
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-582, by Ms. Pingree (ME).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-582, by Ms. Pingree (ME).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3534) to provide greater efficiencies, transparency, returns, and accountability in the administration of Federal mineral and energy resources by consolidating administration of various Federal energy minerals management and leasing programs into one entity to be known as the Office of Federal Energy and Minerals Leasing of the Department of the Interior, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5851) to provide whistleblower protections to certain workers in the offshore oil and gas industry.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3534) to provide greater efficiencies, transparency, returns, and accountability in the administration of Federal mineral and energy resources by consolidating administration of various Federal energy minerals management and leasing programs into one entity to be known as the Office of Federal Energy and Minerals Leasing of the Department of the Interior, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5851) to provide whistleblower protections to certain workers in the offshore oil and gas industry.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3534) to provide greater efficiencies, transparency, returns, and accountability in the administration of Federal mineral and energy resources by consolidating administration of various Federal energy minerals management and leasing programs into one entity to be known as the Office of Federal Energy and Minerals Leasing of the Department of the Interior, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5851) to provide whistleblower protections to certain workers in the offshore oil and gas industry.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
